titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the James T. Watkins Papers
titlestmt.author: Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

note.p: This encoded finding aid is compliant with Stanford EAD Best Practice Guidelines, Version 1.0.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.abstract: Contents include correspondence, class materials, and files relating to university and political science department activities as well as to Stanford sports.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

acqinfo.p: Gift of Professor James T. Watkins, IV, 1979.

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials in boxes 1-2 are restricted 75 years from date of creation.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: James T. Watkins Papers (SC0209). Department of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: Watkins received his A.B. (1929), A.M. (1934) and PhD. (1941) from Stanford; Professor of Political Science at Stanford (1946-1973; emeritus, 1973-1982).

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: Contents include correspondence, class materials, and files relating to university and political science department activities as well as to Stanford sports.

controlaccess.head: Access Terms
controlaccess.corpname: Stanford University. Department of Political Science.
controlaccess.subject: Athletics
Stanford University--Student housing.

separatedmaterial.p: Materials from Boxes A (Miscellaneous material, 1921-1972), B (Football programs, 1961-1978), and C (Stanford Sports, circa 1961) were put in the 4-digit section.

did.unittitle: Letters of recommendation for students and others, A-K
Letters of recommendation for students and others, L-Z

scopecontent.p: Institute of World Affairs; Institute of International Relations; Speeches given; U.N. Secretary Summer Intern Program; World Affairs Council, Japanese Peace Settlement; Commonwealth Club, Japanese Peace Settlment; Northern California Political Science Association; American Studies Seminar.

PS 400 Incident; Goheen Committee; Watkins Department Chairmanship; Reiligion at Stanford; In Pont summer conference; Woodrow Wilson Fellowship Committee (State); Political Science Building (20), plans; Stanford Today, Tomorrow; Liquor on Campus; Sobley Affair; Danforth fellowship; Mark X (Mark X plus P)

Stanford Alumni Conferences; Committee on Financial Awards (external); Chaparral incident; Black Reports on Stanford Grading; PACE; ASSU Constitutional Revision; Student Affairs Committee; Bunzel incident; Rothburn group; (PA) Mayor's Charter Review Committee.

Watkins Political (?); Fulbright committee (State); ROTC; Political science department, 50th anniversary celebration; Oscar Nelson lighting recommendation; Lyman inaugural dinner; Political science department, Watkins retirement dinner; Conservative persuasion.
Miscellaneous studies in constitutional development of the UN, eight volumes
Phi Delta Theta; Fraternities; IFC; Rush; Sigma Nu; Miscellaneous houses.

Political science 500, Teaching; Political science 232, International relations theory; Political science 124, Government of Japan; Political science 135-145, International relations; Political science 132, Principles/problems in US foreign policy; Political science 147/137, UN and antecedents; Class seating charts to 1968; Class interview sign up sheets and interview notes
Comments and compliments received and given; albums
Watkins activities (to be added to activities boxes); grade books

did.unittitle: Publications (mostly Stanford University), Pi Sigma Alpha correspondence files and minute book
Material (clippings, press releases, some publications, etc) on Stanford University sports
One folder on Honor Code: clippings articles, brochures; one statistical report "Summary of Honor Code Cases"
